content: of scraps +/- 3m per rc stripe = 2 row of head section in total you will have 28 rc stripes sizing notes the crochet method for this beanie is different to working a beanie in the rounds from the brim up or from the crown down this beanie is worked as a flat rectangular piece as a result the stitches will be lying sideways across the width therefore giving it quite a lot of sideway stretch the circumference size stated above is of the finished beanie lying flat unstretched i found that there was ample stretch to fit the size head for the child & adult however if you are concerned that the hat might be too loose or too tight in circumference for the head size you are making remove or add a few more row of your pattern always ending the pattern repeat on row 4 4 the sassy scrappy beanie by off the hook creative ©2025 gauge of main head section only 4 x 4 10 x 10cm = 24 sts 12sc 12 ch1 & 21 row 12 single_crochet & 12 ch1 spaces 21 row please note that different brand dk yarn weights can vary some do work up thicker or thinner this is something to keep in mind when adding different scraps of dk yarn i have added a gauge reference for you to refer to so you can see if you are roughly on track with your sizing if you feel that your gauge is way off then you may need to adjust your hook size the 20st brim width = 4 / 10cm adjusting hook size ● if you have too many row & stitches go up a hook size i e 4mm to 4 5mm ● if you have too few row & stitches go down a hook size i e 4mm to 3 5mm keep adjusting your hook size until you reach the suitable gauge child size 5 the sassy scrappy beanie by off the hook creative ©2025 teen / adult size important notes crochet method this entire beanie pattern is worked as a single flat rectangular piece the textured head section is a moss stitch pattern repeat while the ribbing section is a single_crochet in blo repeat the two short ends are joined together to create a tube the top of the tube/beanie has sts worked together in the round to help narrow the top before pulling it closed you could add a pompom if you would like it is important to note that as the stitches lie sideways around the head the beanie has quite a lot of sideway stretch changing colour when changing colour yarns always end your last st with the new colour and drop the old colour on the ws of your work you do not need to carry your different
